stories.original_headline: Scientists uncover a hidden type of diabetes in newborns
stories.original_summary: Researchers have discovered a rare new type of diabetes that affects babies early in life. The condition is caused by changes in a single gene that prevent insulin-producing cells from working properly. stories.fantasy_headline: Healers Discover New Sweetness Malady in Infants
stories.fantasy_story: The Grand Healers' Guild has found a rare new blood-sweetening malady afflicting the youngest villagers. This sickness arises from a fault in a single thread of life's magic, hindering the body's ability to craft a vital sweetening elixir. When this elixir fails, too much sweetness gathers in the blood, often bringing forth mind-muddling ailments.

stories.original_headline: Scientists finally uncover why statins cause muscle pain
stories.original_summary: A new discovery may explain why so many people abandon cholesterol-lowering statins because of muscle pain and weakness. stories.fantasy_headline: Alchemists Learn Why Heart Potions Cause Weary Limbs
stories.fantasy_story: The Alchemists' Guild has at last understood why some folk suffer from weary limbs after taking the Potions of the Heart's Flow. They found certain potions can grasp vital sinew-strands, causing a small, harmful seepage of inner strength from tiny sinew-chambers. This seepage may be the reason for the aching and weakness in many warriors and common folk.

stories.original_headline: Wikipedia turns 25 and shares a glimpse into the lives of its volunteer editors
stories.original_summary: It's been 25 years since the launch of Wikipedia on January 15th, 2001, and it's come a long way from housing just 100 pages to becoming a behemoth of online knowledge with more than 65 million articles that get almost 15 billion views each month. stories.fantasy_headline: Grand Scroll of All Knowledge Celebrates Quarter-Century
stories.fantasy_story: The Order of the Whispering Archive joyfully marks two and a half decades since the first enchantment of the Grand Scroll of All Knowledge. What began as a few dozen enchanted parchments has grown into a vast repository of over sixty-five million chronicles. These tales are read billions of times monthly, thanks to its devoted scribes.

stories.original_headline: Microsoft, Meta, and Amazon are paying up for ‘enterprise’ access to Wikipedia
stories.original_summary: Microsoft, Meta, Amazon, Perplexity, and Mistral AI have joined Google in paying the Wikimedia Foundation for access to its projects, including Wikipedia's vast collection of articles. stories.fantasy_headline: Mighty Guilds Pay for Grand Scroll's Deepest Lore
stories.fantasy_story: Great Merchant Guilds and Sorcerer Clans, including those of Azure, the Shifting Realm, and the River Bazaar, now offer rich tributes to the Order of the Whispering Archive. They seek privileged access to the Grand Scroll of All Knowledge's deepest lore. This new arrangement, announced during the Scroll's anniversary, strengthens its purpose.
